description: Urban Expeditions is a local travel company. Our mission is to help you engage the city, explore culture and connect with the environment. Escape the grind of urban life using one of our 4 hour city tours. Our city tours always include a private small group experience, transportation, refreshments and a guide.

reviews.title: Loved it, but be prepared to walk!
text: My brother and I were visiting Toronto for the first time. There were only two of us doing this tour on the day, so the tour was customized for us. We were brought on a (mostly) walking tour of Toronto, and got to see some of the local neighborhoods, all of which had their distinct character. My favorite part was getting to see the local hang-outs that most tourists wouldn't visit, e.g. the converted quarry and distillery.
All in all, great tour, I'd even recommend it for locals!

reviews.title: Bacon, Beer & Bricks spells Toronto & no one explains it like urban expeditions!
text: My wife and I walking-toured with Urban Expeditions first thing upon our arrival in Toronto. Our guide spent over 4 hrs with us, covered 18,000 steps & gave us a real feel for the layout, life and legacy of the city. Timely usage of a little public transportation helped us enjoy the full gamut of this metropolis which included stunning skyline views, peaceful trail hiking, foods, vibrant neighborhoods and historic sites.  It really helped us for the rest of our stay and activities in Toronto.  I suspect our guide was unequaled in his knowledge, good nature and ability to make us feel connected.  I highly recommend the tour and the people behind it!

reviews.title: Learned so much!
text: This is a fantastic tour! Learned so much, saw so much. I feel like we went to so many different parts of the city which was really great since this was my first time in Toronto. I would absolutely recommend this tour to anyone needing to get their bearings or learn more about their city!

reviews.title: Do it!
text: This is a activities for a group new to a city! I got to run around Toronto, learn about cool places I wouldn't otherwise see, got closer with my teammates and some yummy food was provided! Highly recommended!

reviews.title: Interesting Experience
text: Part of the school's orientation.  It was nice to see the city and find some cool spots I wouldn't have found/ seen otherwise.  I found the spots were quite spread out with limited time so I only managed to get to about a third.  The spots weren't really geared for the audience (i.e. students) but this would be a great activity for new comers to the city.

reviews.title: Fun and lots of historical sites
text: Lots of walking. Some places were difficult to access or unclear but overall, most goals were fun. Be sure to take be careful not to walk into traffic but that should be common sense.

reviews.title: The best way to see the city!
text: Peter was awesome and took us on a great walking tour around downtown and the surrounding areas. The walk was extremely laid back and offered plenty of stops to take in the sights etc. Highly recommend Urban Expeditions!

reviews.title: Cultural Mosaic with Urban Expeditions
text: Excellent tour. Peter is super knowledgeable about the city. And I came away with a better idea of Toronto's culture. Plus a great walk!

reviews.title: Awesome relaxed walking tour
text: This tour was awesome! Peter knows the city and its history in and out. The historical information was very insightful. This tour should work great for all types of travelers, including families with kids, couples and solo travelers.

reviews.title: Great way to see the city as a local.
text: This expedition was the highlight of my Toronto trip. Peter is so knowledgeable about the city and educated me in a very casual and conversational way. I was able to explore and learn about places in the city that I would have never ventured to as a visiting tourist. This is definitely time well spent and is perfect to do on your first days visiting Toronto so that you can go back and see some of your favorite spots along the tour on your own.

reviews.title: Great way to spend the afternoon.
text: I experienced Urban Expeditions as part of a team building exercise with my company. It was a lot of fun to discover new places in Toronto with some new friends. Great way to spend the afternoon getting out of the office and being active. Learned a lot about the city I never knew.

reviews.title: Race across Toronto
text: Definitely a good workout walking across the city. A great way to get out of the office and see Toronto!

reviews.title: Fun afternoon if your team takes it seriously!
text: We spent the afternoon running around downtown Toronto to various parts of the city to get points at different checkpoints. My partner and I were both competitive and took the game seriously, so we had a great time. Other teams weren't as serious, and so didn't have as much fun. It's very well organized, and a great team building exercise with the others on your team.

reviews.title: Great experience!
text: Great workout and amazing opportunity to explore the city! The staff were very organized and enthusiastic.

reviews.title: Good time
text: Had a good time, the event ran smoothly. We had a scavenger hunt around the city which allowed us to see some cool things.

reviews.title: Urban Expeditions
text: We decided to start our visit to Toronto with an Urban Expeditions tour. It was the best way to get connected with and understand the amazing area. Peter was an excellent guide. He showed us Toronto from every angle. He listened to our preferences and created the most beautiful experience for us. We enjoyed our day with Peter so much and really appreciated all the great insider information he had for us. We could tell he enjoys what he does and has such an appreciation for the area. Highly recommend this tour and Peter.

reviews.title: 2 days in Toronto
text: We had a Great time and it was a perfect way for us to see Toronto.
We were on a coffee-tour and on an all-round tour to places we could not have found our self.

reviews.title: This is where it's at!
text: This was our first visit to Toronto and I didn’t want to do the typical tourist excursion. We were looking for a unique experience and we got it with Peter of Urban Expedition.  We booked at the last minute and Peter was gracious to fit us in.  Communication was great as he promptly responded to my all my inquiries.
We were picked up from our hotel, given a quick preliminary orientation and had an amazing day!! It was the type of experience we hoped for and yet, it exceeded our expectations.

Peter is genuine, professional, intelligent, energetic and fun. The tour was customized to our interests and the experience was akin to having our very own personal concierge/travel guide…with the feel of hanging out with an cool friend.  Peter was attentive to our needs at every turn…whether we needed a quick break, a snack, etc. he took care of it all.

We really appreciated the manner in which he engaged our teenaged daughter and held her interest. This was not surface information, he really knows his stuff and shared it in a manner that can only come from someone who has a strong sense of community and a passion for learning.

We were able to visit a variety of places and learn about the local culture.  After our time with Peter, we felt a bit more like locals rather than tourists. He was kind enough to follow up and share even more valuable information on the activities we had planned for the next day.

We had an awesome time with Peter and will recommend his services to our friends.  A couple of things to keep in mind is to wear comfortable shoes.  This is a fast paced four hour walk. We covered a lot of ground visiting a variety of places in a short time. Secondly, come with an open mind and an adventurous spirit, Peter will take care of the rest!

reviews.title: Missing prize nearly one year after participating
text: My company used Urban Expeditions for a private team building event. It was okay, the game itself has a weak premise (run around the city and take photos of businesses that they've partnered with).

They only gave the winning (my) team half the advertised prizes. It's been almost a year since we participated and they've become completely unresponsive. It's frustrating to be misled. Would not recommend to any company.
